thread.title: Avon’s Bertus Brothers To Compete In Badlands Circuit Finals Rodeo
thread.title_full: Avon’s Bertus Brothers To Compete In Badlands Circuit Finals Rodeo

title: Avon’s Bertus Brothers To Compete In Badlands Circuit Finals Rodeo
text:
Avon’s Bertus Brothers To Compete In Badlands Circuit Finals Rodeo 0 comments 
MINOT, N.D. – Brothers Jeff and Joe Bertus are among the 94 cowboys and cowgirls set to compete in the Badlands Circuit Finals Rodeo, Oct. 8-11 in Minot. 
Both are set to compete in bull riding. Jeff Bertus currently ranks eighth on the circuit in that event, and has won the average title at this event three consecutive seasons. 
The Badlands Circuit is made up of the 25 pro rodeos across North and South Dakota. Qualifiers to the Badlands Circuit Finals Rodeo must compete at a minimum of ten rodeos for Dakota residents and fifteen for non-residents. 
Tickets are available for the Ram Badlands Circuit Finals Rodeo, hosted by the Minot Y’s Men’s Rodeo. The rodeo, held October 8-11 at the State Fair Center in Minot, determines the year end champion for all pro rodeos in North and South Dakota. The rodeo will pay out over $200,000 and will determine the year end and average winner in each event, who will represent the circuit at the Ram National Circuit Finals Rodeo next April. For more information on the rodeo and to purchase tickets, visit www.minotysmensrodeo.com .
